Lux is disgustingly broken.

2 stuns.

aoe slow, aoe damage, unavoidable damage at that now that she can detonate on site.  If you're anywhere within 600 range it's impossible to avoid without flash.

10 shields.  She can hit every ally with it twice so yes, 10 shields.  And even if she doesn't aim she gets two shields by default for herself.

Long range ult that procs passive.

Passive gives her yet even more burst damage.

High range equivalent to Xerath but without any of the negatives Xerath has that makes him balanced.

She doesn't get movement speed penalties.

Her range, while generally shorter than Xerath is not low enough to justify not having penalties akin to Xerath.  Nevermind that xerath is less overloaded than her:

Single stun

Smaller aoe damage and slow, requires center hit to do max slow and damage

Has to charge up for max range on Q, slow movement speed while doing so

Has to stand still during ult.  Lux technically does this too but she only needs to aim once and only stands there for what, 1.5 seconds?  Xerath needs at least 3 to fire off his shots.

With those items? Depends. While I usually go Luden's over Zhonya's second, I tend to one shot anything on Lux.

With thooooose specifically and with her runes being 15 flat AP and 8 flat MPen, plus 15 MPen from the boots to total 23. Vel here runs 12 MR and had 25 more from the Athene's, so he's at 67, minus the 23 now and he's at 44. 44 is around 30% reduction. 

Given Lux finished with a Luden's, Blasting, and a Rabadon's on top of it all, I'd guess Vel got fed early and had 4 items by about level 14-15ish and with his lead, he had about 2 levels on Lux, so she'd be about level 13. That means she has max Q and E and a level 2 R, so 225% of he AP plus 114 from her passive (10+8xlvl), 260 from Q, 240 from E, and 400 from R. That's 1114 base plus 225% of her AP. Given I looked her up, she has 15 flat AP and standard 21/0/9 as a Lux set up, so flat 6 and 12ish from the scaling in Masteries, plus the 5% overall. Zhonya's gives 100, Nomicon gives 80. That's 213 AP, which after Dragon and the 5% from masteries, she's at about 236. 225% of 236 is 531. So she's doing 1645 damage. Vel'Koz at level 15 has about 1517, totaling 1817 after Liandry's. 

It would seem she wouldn't have nearly enough given with 1817hp and 44 MR (After MPen), meaning he has about 2616ish damage he can take of magic damage. Given Lux's kit, it wouldn't be a surprise if he was missing about 300 health because she had poked with an E prior before catching him in the full combo and ending the combo with a single AA.

As a player dedicated strongly to both mages and Lux specifically, I'll say this: Lux is fine. Not weak, not broken, not really strong, **_fine_**.

Does she blow people up? Yeah. Check my match history and look. If you're gonna play {{champion:103}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:1}} or {{champion:7}} , think you can rush {{item:3165}} and not get punished for it (more than half my Lux games in the last two patches were exactly this) then **of course** she's gonna blow you up. Hell, the vast majority of AP mids don't even use MR glyphs: they're greedy and go AP. They buy boots late to try and rush damage. They upgrade them late. 

If you're going to do that, don't wonder why you keep dying. It's not the snare+burst combo that's killing you, it's the 5 or 6 Lucent Singularities that you ate at the start of the game before you died. Then it was the 4 or 5 more when you got **back to lane** before she killed you again. **_THEN_** it was the snare+burst combo because you're now 2 kills down and you wasted gold on 5 {{item:2003}} every time you died because you're too slow and predictable to dodge anything

I run MR glyphs and I had an {{item:3174}}, not a {{item:3165}}. I think 60-70 MR should have been fine for my survival if I'm 3 or 4 kills up.

Plus, your point is that Lux wins the majority of her matchups because people don't know how to itemise and people can't dodge the circle that nobody that doesn't buy boots can walk out of.
Wasn't she like that before? She could always burst someone down. I don't remember her getting any damage buffs, only buffs that helped her feel smoother.
I never said I was complaining about buffs, I was complaining about how insane the burst was in general.
She was always like that, what's the difference between then and now? The only problem is play rate. She's being played too much.

Being played more means more people will see how powerful their kit is, and have the right to complain more.
